Back to Terran Builds

Fast 3rd CC

Matchup: TvZ (primarily)

Difficulty: Intermediate-Advanced

This build is great against the TvZ matchup because the Zerg opponent will almost always be out-mining you. This economic strategy focuses on matching Zerg's expansion speed to compete in the late game.

Build Order

  1. 14 Supply Depot
  2. 16 Barracks
  3. 16 Refinery
  4. 19 Orbital Command
  5. 19 Supply Depot
  6. 21 Command Center (Natural)
  7. 21 Factory
  8. 23 Refinery
  9. 26 Starport
  10. 28 Command Center (Third)
  11. 30 Engineering Bay
  12. 32 Bunker (if needed vs pressure)
  13. @Factory: Hellions or Widow Mines
  14. @Starport: Medivacs or Vikings
  15. Continue economic development

Execution Guide

Early Game (0-6 minutes)

  • Execute standard Terran opening
  • Take natural expansion at 21 supply
  • Build Factory for tech structure
  • Scout Zerg's build order and aggression timing
  • Focus on SCV production over military

Economic Phase (6-10 minutes)

  • Take third Command Center early (around 6-7 minutes)
  • Build minimal defensive units (Hellions/Marines)
  • Get Starport for mobility/detection
  • Scout heavily for Zerg timing attacks
  • Prepare defensive measures if needed

Transition Phase (10+ minutes)

  • Saturate all three bases with SCVs
  • Add production facilities (Barracks/Factories)
  • Choose army composition based on Zerg's strategy
  • Get upgrades and tech up
  • Maintain economic advantage

Key Strategic Points

  • Economic Focus: Prioritize economy over early military
  • Scouting Critical: Must know when Zerg attacks
  • Defensive Preparation: Ready to defend timing attacks
  • Late Game Strength: Superior economy for extended games
  • Risk vs Reward: Vulnerable early, powerful late

Defending Against Zerg Aggression

Early Aggression (6-8 minutes)

Common Attacks

  • Speedling Floods: Wall off, bunkers, Marines
  • Roach Rushes: Marauders, bunkers, repair SCVs
  • Baneling Busts: Spread buildings, Marine splits

General Defense

  • Don't over-react to small attacks
  • Use minimum defense necessary
  • Keep economic focus

Mid-Game Pressure (8-12 minutes)

Common Threats

  • Roach/Hydra timing attacks
  • Mutalisk harassment
  • Nydus worm all-ins

Defense Strategy

  • Sensor Towers for early warning
  • Turrets vs air harassment
  • Bunkers at choke points

Late Game Transitions (12+ minutes)

Zerg Compositions

  • Ling/Bane/Muta: Bio with Thor support
  • Roach/Hydra/Viper: Tank/Marine composition
  • Brood Lord/Corruptor: Viking/Marine/Ghost

Your Advantage

  • Superior economy from 3 bases
  • Better production facilities
  • Technology advantages

Build Variations

Safe Variation

  • Add extra Bunkers if under pressure
  • Get Sensor Tower earlier for detection
  • Add second Barracks before third CC
  • Research Stim earlier for defense

Greedy Variation

  • Skip early military completely
  • Take third CC even earlier (around 5:30)
  • Focus purely on economy until 10+ minutes
  • High risk but massive economic advantage

SCV Saturation Guidelines

  • Main Base: 16 on minerals, 6 on gas (22 total)
  • Natural: 16 on minerals, 6 on gas (22 total)
  • Third Base: 16 on minerals, 6 on gas (22 total)
  • Total Goal: 66 SCVs for full saturation
  • Timing: Should reach 50+ SCVs by 10 minutes

Production Guidelines

6-8 Minutes

  • 1 Barracks, 1 Factory, 1 Starport
  • Constant SCV production from all CCs
  • Minimal unit production (2-4 Marines)
  • Focus on infrastructure

8-12 Minutes

  • Add 2-3 more Barracks
  • Add Engineering Bay for upgrades
  • Begin unit production
  • Add Armory if going mech

12+ Minutes

  • 6-8 Barracks or 3-4 Factories
  • Multiple upgrade facilities
  • Constant unit production
  • Consider 4th base expansion

Composition Transitions

Bio Transition

  • Core: Marines, Marauders, Medivacs
  • Support: Tanks, Mines, Vikings
  • Upgrades: +1/+1 Infantry, Stim, Combat Shield
  • Production: 6-8 Barracks, 2 Starports

Mech Transition

  • Core: Hellions, Tanks, Thors
  • Support: Vikings, Ravens, Banshees
  • Upgrades: +1/+1 Mech, Drilling Claws
  • Production: 3-4 Factories, 2 Starports

Common Mistakes

  • Taking third CC too greedily without scouting
  • Not building enough defensive units
  • Poor SCV distribution across bases
  • Forgetting to add production facilities
  • Not scouting Zerg's army composition
  • Over-committing to economy vs early aggression
  • Not getting key defensive upgrades
  • Improper army positioning for defense

Advanced Tips

  • Use Sensor Towers to spot incoming attacks early
  • Keep Hellions alive for map control and scouting
  • Scanner Sweep key Zerg tech buildings regularly
  • Pre-split SCVs to avoid Baneling damage
  • Use supply drops to avoid supply blocks
  • Consider Planetary Fortress at third base vs ground armies

Upgrade Priority

  1. Stim Pack: Essential for defense
  2. +1 Attack: From Engineering Bay
  3. Combat Shield: Marine survivability
  4. +1 Armor: Complete first upgrade cycle
  5. +2/+2: Continue upgrade advantage
  6. +3/+3: Late game superiority
